intro: Ilysanthes gracilis, commonly known as the slender ilysanthes, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
